snippet: Several survivors said Thursday that as the fire spread, plant managers forced them to stay in order to save the company’s stock: piles of stonewashed jeans.
abstract: Outrage swells in Karachi, Pakistan, over the 289 garment workers killed in a fire at the Ali Enterprises factory; owners, who forced workers to stay in the building to save the company's stock, are being sought by police.
lead_paragraph: Several survivors said Thursday that as the fire spread, plant managers forced them to stay in order to save the company’s stock: piles of stonewashed jeans.

headline.seo: Anger and Grief Across Karachi After Factory Fire
headline.main: Anger Rolls Across Pakistani City in Aftermath of Factory Fire
headline.print_headline: Anger Rolls Across Pakistani City in Aftermath of Factory Fire
